job queuing, scheduling and processing is handled by a Windows service, mmServer, which for security reasons runs in the context of a designated 'runAs' user, with standard (non-administrator) privileges. During installation you will be prompted for the name and password of the Miramo Server 'runAs' user (default is mmUser); if the user does not already exist it will be created. The specified user may not have administrative privileges.
To install, right-click on the MiramoEnterprisepNNNsetup.exe extracted from the downloaded ZIP distribution package, and select ’RunAs Administrator’, then follow the instructions given.
When prompted for the Miramo runAs user, specify ’mmUser’ (or a user name of your choice, providing it is not an existing administrator user) as the service ’runAs’ user:
Here is the final dialog box displayed during the installation process:
Clicking on Finish will display the following dialog:
Click on OK to continue to the main window which will show the service status as ’Running’ (providing the current license is valid - see for information on obtaining a new license if the license has expired, or is invalid.)
